description:
After removal of daemonization using python-daemon we lost an ability to save traces from running services.

Running nova-{api,compute,network,objectstore,scheduler} apps as a service called daemonization process.
This is typical code for daemonization in plain C:

chdir("/");
umask(022);
setpgid(0,0);
fd=open("/dev/null", O_RDWR); /* stdin */
dup(fd); /* stdout */
dup(fd); /* stderr */

Please note last three lines: daemons does not have it's own STDIN, STDOUT and STDERR - by definition - they are daemons ;-)

That's why we need to save traces in logs.

Right now traces are not saved which lead us to strange results from admin's point of view.

nova-volume is a nice example: it does not start using default configuration since it can't find nova-volume group.
But there are now sufficient information in /var/log/nova/nova-volume.log :

$ cat /var/log/nova/nova-volume.log 
2011-01-27 18:29:08,830 nova.root: Starting volume node (version 2011.1-workspace:tarmac-20110126011942-r43lhaunqljr9hwr)

Turning on use_syslog and verbose options in /etc/nova/nova.conf does not helped.
title: Need to put python TRACEs into logs

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~abrindeyev

comments.content: I can't replicate this.  I get full tracebacks in logs with --verbose on (without --use_syslog)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content:
Yep. You are trying to test it on Ubuntu packaging which uses simple STD{OUT,ERR} redirection in Nova services upstart scripts instead of utilizing --logfile option.

With redirection you will have troubles with utilites which altering logfiles (like logrotate) so I can't use that method.

Could you please re-test?

Upstart scripts are located in /etc/init directory.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~abrindeyev

comments.content: Is there a problem with doing logrotate as it is done in the ubuntu packages?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content:
Correct, in Ubuntu logrotate settings there is "restart nova-$service" instead of "reload nova-$service".

We need to do reload instead of restart.
This is to ensure that we will not miss any request to service in the middle of stop; start sequence.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~abrindeyev
